description: The round payoff this round was 90. You, John chose to play option 2.Kate chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 90.
Choosing option 2 when the opponent chooses option 1 maximizes your payoff
Mutual cooperation (both choosing option 1) splits the payoff evenly, while mutual defection (both choosing option 2) reduces the total payoff and splits it
Option 2 is a risky but potentially rewarding choice if the opponent does not also choose it
The game resembles a prisoner's dilemma-like structure where individual incentives may lead to suboptimal collective outcomes
Observing the opponent's past actions is crucial for future strategy
